p: Cost and production are critical concerns, but even more important is having confidence that our drugs will work – and will do no harm. As this article went to press, the global death toll from the new coronavirus was racing past 25,000. People are desperate for effective treatments as soon as possible. But we can't act in haste, says Lane. “In an outbreak like this, it's crucial to find out which interventions are truly of benefit and implement them widely,” he says. Just as important, though, is to “eliminate those interventions that aren't and get them out of the way”.
